args:
Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" .
Democrats settle on candidate for Rep. Stefanik’s seat
Democratic Party leaders in New York’s 21st Congressional District have backed farmer Blake Gendebien for the anticipated special election to replace Republican Rep. Elise Stefanik, President Donald Trump’s pick to be U.N. ambassador.
The party chairs in the 15 counties that make up the district released a statement Tuesday unanimously endorsing Gendebien, calling him a political “outsider” who “embodies the voice and grit that distinguishes this district.”
The race would be an uphill battle for Democrats — Stefanik won reelection last year by over 20 percentage points — but it could serve as a gauge of Democratic enthusiasm in the first months of the second Trump term. New York Gov. Kathy Hochul (D) gets to schedule the special election once Stefanik is confirmed and gives up her seat.
Republican leaders in the district have not picked a candidate yet.
